top_comment.text:
JACKSON! My cat luna loves to fall asleep on my bed, or the sofa. Because i 
am 12 and at school, i only really see her in evenings and weekends. When i 
get home,mshe gets very exited, then sleeps. When she wakes up she starts 
licking my arms, hands and face. Why?﻿
top_comment.author: megaladin 1

you are either bro-bro the man or mister cat daddy, and it's worth waking

Those are "kitty kisses". She's telling you she loves you and missed you

comments.author: Cindy Bird

top_comment.text:
What is the best food for cats? I definitely do not like whiskas, which 
made my cat and addict, I like purine cat chow better, but I would like to 
know more about other brands which are better for the health of the cat. 
Though sometimes it is harder to find them in Latin America, where I 
live...﻿
top_comment.author: darackshami

comments.text:
Yes I think you should try fancy feast it is the only wet food I will feed 
my cat. I give him only whole can every night and always something 
different. He likes the gravy and trout the best but he eats them all. I 
pay 50 cents a can and well worth the money at Walmart. Petco wanted too 
much. I also give my cat indoor outdoor dry food by purina. it is in a 
green bag
comments.author: Alexis Chioini

comments.text:
Lol, you should try fancy feast, I think I have shares in the company by 
now, our cat is almost permanently sitting in from of the fridge and you 
should see the tricks he performs to try and get us to feed him fancy 
feast.  We TRY to limit it but before long we have to submit.  Fun though 
it is almost a game now between us and him.  They are so clever we watch to 
see what new trick he thinks up to get it our of us.
comments.author: Wilma Van Aswegen

top_comment.text:
I have no idea how old one of my cats are... Is there anyway to tell? 
Please answer!!!﻿
top_comment.author: KatieCat Casper

comments.text: +Connie Faye thanks! :3
comments.author: KatieCat Casper

comments.text: yes dental records can give an approximation. best of luck
comments.author: Lynn Athans

comments.text:
When they are younger it's easier for the vet to gauge their age based on 
their teeth (baby teeth vs adult teeth).  Then they can estimate on the 
tartar build up (if they've never been in for a dental).
comments.author: Connie Faye

top_comment.text:
After our incident with a Banfield Vet refusing to diagnosing my cat Tassel 
with diabetes. (because he was milking us for all of these other tests not 
related to her condition, and apparently he told his boss that I was 
refusing to give her insulin.  She approached me to ask why, I told her 
that wasn't the case but really it was the other way around.)  I started 
reading everything I could on Feline Diabetes.  Hers wasn't the case where 
it would clear up if she got under a certain weight.  We eventually had to 
put her to sleep because again, another vet didn't or wouldn't address her 
kidney disease (later in life).  Since then I've found a much better vet & 
trust their judgement.  And I've tried to educate people about, Declawing, 
Feline Diabetes, Kidney Disease, & Hyperthyroid.﻿
top_comment.author: Connie Faye

comments.text:
I can only assume certain practitioners from Banfield or operators have 
this issue you've described Connie Faye. It's truly horrendous what you 
described!!

My mom has used them for years and has been very satisfied and I'm 
considering them for my area of the country (because of cost). For he past 
14 years, I've been very happy with my vet. She has recently retired and 
sold her practice. I've no problem with the new vet ( a note here, the 
practice before and now, deals exclusively with cats). My now 17 year old 
cat is losing weight. Her blood work has come back that everything's fine 
(slightly elevated thyroid). I'm getting estimates on an ultrasound. Vet is 
suspecting kidney based on her physical assessment..

Here's where second opinion comes in to play. Vet is making an educated 
guess on an exam (she felt there might be an obstruction) and a clean lab 
report. Cotton has been eating and eliminating normally. What has been 
different is 1. refusing dry food and 2. weight (she's lost .8 lb - that's 
point eight). 

Vet found a laceration on Cotton's gum, which could explain not eating dry 
stuff - it's an owie! :(

And yes, I do plan to search and question. Without a specific diagnosis, I 
guess I go down the list of stuff vet request ultrasounds for.Also, if I 
attend her mouth first. New vet says that's a low priority at the moment, 
but if it's painful to eat - even wet food...?
comments.author: imaof4

comments.text:
I heard a lot of things about that company. I'm glad you did what you felt 
was right
comments.author: Genta

comments.text:
+shannonigans86
After we got Tassel all regulated, she was back to normal, normal energy, 
attitude, playfulness.  The thing is she got so sick from that vet, she was 
barely 7lb - nothing but skin and bones.  She knew when it was time for her 
meds and would come to get me.
comments.author: Connie Faye

comments.text:
Was your cat a type 1 diabetic? My cat was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes 
earlier this year. Her first vet also refused to test her for diabetes 
since she was so young (only about 6 months old when she started showing 
symptoms -- just over a year old when she was finally diagnosed). We 
finally found a great vet who diagnosed her right away so we could start 
treating her disease. With insulin, giving her high-quality food and giving 
her regular exercise her diabetes is finally under control and at nearly 2 
she's way more energetic than she was when we first adopted her. Type 1 
diabetes is rare in cats but definitely not impossible, and I feel like 
more needs to be done to spread the word about it.
comments.author: shannonigans86

top_comment.text:
I've learned alot from you Jackson. My cat used to scratch and be angry. I 
saw your show and a few high perches for him and playing more(with the 
perches he became more interested in playing too). Now he is super cuddly.
He is 14 years old now. Had a urinary tract infections when he was 4 and 5 
years old. Ever since then I watered down his gravy food to make sure he 
drank more liquids. Vet said they don't live past 8 years when they have 
these infections. I just wish I learned about the high perches earlier 
because he scratched and bit for since he was about 3 years old until 
10years old. It was like he was wild.
 
Only thing that bothers him now is arthritis, especially in the winter. Any 
advice for that?﻿
top_comment.author: ThePeacemaker848

comments.text:
My cats dont have arthritis, but in the winter I break out a nice heating 
blanket and will use tables in other rooms (or chairs) that arent really 
used much to create a "cave" or tent area, with the heating blanket inside. 
You gotta put another thin blanket over it tho so they have more padding 
between themselves and the heating portions of the blanket. How high or low 
its set at depends on how cold it is. 

My point being, my cats love it. Theyll nap in there happily in the 
wintertime, and warm laundry is supposed to be good for little old ladies 
(humans lol) with arthritis, so it may be worth it for you to go out and 
buy a cheap winter-heating-blanket and find a nice spot for it for your 
kitty!
comments.author: Riko Lime

comments.text:
Get a heating pad for him to lay on. It helps ease the joints. Don't put it 
on high though. Low will work just fine. My Cat Midnight had arthritis the 
last 3 years of his life. The heating pad is the only thing that really 
worked for him in winter.
comments.author: Cindy Bird

top_comment.text: The Internet can be such a helpful resource for pet care! ﻿

comments.text: Cute kitty

top_comment.text:
Our cat Wiley was put on a Science Diet formula for overweight cats. He got 
real sick shortly after, being diagnosed with disseminated intravascular 
coagulation. He was in the vet hospital for a week and put on IV and 
recovered, but only for about 11 months. He took ill again and died. I feel 
it was the food that made him sick, but we can't prove it. I couldn't find 
anything on the internet about this food making pets ill.﻿
top_comment.author: Rita Brown

little bit salt for improve taste of eating for cats. Cats will ask the 
food again and again. TRY OUT dude
comments.author: anesia mega sari

comments.text:
I got a few samples of Science Diet for neutered males home from the vet 
and it definitely gave my cat lose stool, even though I did mix it in with 
his usual food.

Definitely not a food brand I'd personally go with for my cat.
comments.author: Mini Manta

comments.text:
I've been happy with Blue Buffalo.(is expensive though). Would do a raw 
diet, but just as I shy away from making tofu at home, I've concerns about

comments.author: imaof4

comments.text:
+falcolf Actually the FDA's recall site is the best site to check. They 
have EVERY recalled pet food on their list.
comments.author: Cindy Bird

comments.text:
And please don't educate yourself at pet food manufacturer websites. Go 
elsewhere instead. A very good site is 'Little Big Cat' - just google it. :)
comments.author: falcolf

comments.text:
Science Diet is not worth being used as a door stop. Guys, you need to look 
at the ingredients of your cat food - my rule is, as much NAMED meat as 
possible (such as for example 'chicken' or 'deboned turkey,') meat as the 
first ingredient, NO corn, NO wheat (these grains are VERY bad for our 
carnivorous pets!) NO beet pulp (cats do NOT require fibre in their diets 
and neither do dogs - they are carnivores and their natural diet does NOT 
include it,) NO byproducts (usually the byproducts are not fit for human 
consumption so they are not fit for your pet either) and please keep in 
mind that what grain or veggies that are in the food are of usually very 
little benefit to the cat. I will say that a food with berries such as 
blueberries or cranberries in it is a very good idea because they help 
acidify the urinary tract which helps prevent urinary crystals. It is also 
prudent to mention that dry kibble diets are inferior and that much better, 
health promoting diets are ones that are wet. If you can't afford raw and 
you can't afford to feed straight canned food, then at least supplement 
your cat's diet with canned food, or find a way to turn your cat's kibble 
into wet food. (Chicken broth would probably do very well - make sure that 
it doesn't include onion or garlic which are poisonous to cats.) As a 
general rule, any food available in a grocery store is no good. Cats don't 
need fancy shapes or food colouring and they certainly do not need 
vegetables. They need meat from named sources and liquid in their diet (not 
just water on the side) because cats came from the Egyptian desert and out 
there, animals get most of their water from their food because water just 
isn't usually readily available. As a result, most of our domestic cats are 
chronically dehydrated because they are never fed properly moist food. A 
moist diet is the best preventative to most diseases, especially urinary 
tract crystals. Please educate yourself about pet nutrition! It's the best 
thing that you can do for your animal to promote your pet's long term 
health - and cats, when cared for properly, can easily live to 20 or more 
years. One of my cats right now is 17 and going strong.
comments.author: falcolf

comments.text:
+Rita Brown He's beautiful. I am so sorry you lost him. We got Duke after 
having to put down another cat, Midnight. He was 15 years old and his 
kidneys shut down. The Vet tried to get them going again but they never 
kicked back in. We had to put him down. I cried for days. I know how hard 
it is when you lose your best, cuddle-buddy.
comments.author: Cindy Bird

comments.text:
+Cindy Bird We learned that lesson too late for Wiley, unfortunately. Wiley 
had kidney problems as well. It didn't start until after the Science Diet. 
He was my buddy. That's his pic in my avatar.
comments.author: Rita Brown

comments.text:
We rescued my male cat Duke, from the Humane Society. He was 3 months old 
when we got him. They had him on Science Diet and he couldn't even eat it 
because the bites were too hard for him to chew. He was very skinny when we 
got him. He didn't even weigh a pound. I immediately put him on Kitten Chow 
and supplemented with Kitten Formula. He gained 6 ounces in 4 days! Science 
Diet Dog Food is currently on a recall list due to Salmonella. I know the 
Cat Food was under recall back when the Chinese-made cat foods were 
recalled. Always check the recall lists before feeding any new or different 
brand cat food. And I never feed any food not made completely in the U.S. 
Chinese dog food has been killing dogs for 5 years or more. It causes 
kidney problems. I don't want to run the risk their cat food does too.
comments.author: Cindy Bird

top_comment.text:
My cat has moments when her eyes dilate and she becomes really aggressive 
but then 30 seconds later she acts like nothing happened. I don't know 
whats wrong with her but she did use to be a street cat for about a year 
until we got her. Could she have some kind of PTSD for cats?﻿
top_comment.author: MeowMimiCat

comments.text:
Mine do that on occasion, luckily when they're like that they respond to 
the word easy and ow. But normally if they see something they'd like to 
attack (even playfully) and I get in their way is when this 
happens.(something rolls across the floor, other cats running amuck an 
playing etc...)
comments.author: Taylor Mick

comments.text:
one can tell if a cat is afraid or angry depending on whether or not their 
eyes are dilated or not.. In fact there is a ton of info on line about 
that, I just read check it out. very interesting and will help you, best of

comments.author: Lynn Athans

top_comment.text:
I firmly believe my vet killed my cat. The moron gave my kitty a rabies 
shot (without informing me prior, or me giving consent) while I left the 
cat at the office to get a biopsy of a tumor. Just like humans, animals 
should NEVER be given vaccinations while they are ill. I was using natural 
methods to help heal my kitty, and had started feeding raw, and the tumor 
seemed like it was responding...before the shot. My sweet, first cat I ever 
had, went only downhill after that, and had to be put to sleep. (Thank God 
there are vets here in my area who come to your home to perform that 
service.) It was a rough lesson on trusting vets. I now feed raw, and I 
also use a ceramic drinking fountain for my cats--not plastic. Another 
kitty I had who was sickly for 10 years, has been healed solely through 
these changes.﻿
top_comment.author: procrastistamper

comments.text:
+bloxyman22 My hubby's dad has been a vet for decades, and agrees. So do I, 
which is why I never consented to any vaccinations other than the ones the 
shelter made me get. I still miss my Sneakers kitty, he was the biggest 
sweetie ever!
comments.author: procrastistamper

comments.text:
Even if the cat was healthy vaccines can be seriously risky and can cause 
all kinds of issues like random auto immune diseases, allergies and so on 
in both pets and humans. I would personally always keep vaccinations to a 
minimum.
comments.author: bloxyman22

comments.text:
+baka13bonbon
Yeah, I got the card to bring the cat in for followup, too. I know not all 
vets are this callous, but since my cat died this way, I have heard SOOOO 
many similar sad tales. Wish I'd heard these tales before I left my kitty 
with that vet. I even researched vets, this was the only one near me who 
(claimed) to support holistic treatment, and all the reviews I could find 
were good.

comments.text:
Sorry that happened. A vet killed my mom's dog by telling her to give him

top_comment.text:
A few years ago I did my research and found out my cat had diabetes, took 
him to the vet and the vet said no he didn't and that was a lie, another

top_comment.author: Darcypink Cobb

comments.text:
+squirrel1ification I had a boy cat who had a uti and recently one of my 
girls got one. What iv figured out is with 4 cats 2 boys i lost yrs ago and 
my 2 girls now love to pee when i go (i kno tmi). But u can try to put the 
litter box in the bathroom and he might use the litter box more when he 
sees u go. Weird i kno but cats can be like babies sometimes. Also my 
Buttercup poops n my bed when she misses me and im gone to long. Hope this 
helps
comments.author: Darcypink Cobb

comments.text:
+Sweetpea Chickpea thank u for ur support sister. I'll never understand how 
cruel and dumb ppl are. How can a person go to school to be a vet or doctor 
with so much hate and disregard for life is forever beyond me. PEACE AND 
LOVE girls
comments.author: Darcypink Cobb

comments.text: i'm so sorry, that is heartbreaking :-( we here love ya sister
comments.author: Sweetpea Chickpea

comments.text:
I think what most of us have come to learn that just like with humans, we 
have to be the biggest advocator for our pets. Yes, the vets office may 
think of you as being a major pain in the ass, but so what. We know our 
pets better than anyone else.

For the past 2+ years one of my male cats has been dealing with UTIs and 
kidney infections. We went from him (and our other cats) being on Hills 
Prescription CD to their KD formula. Yet the problem still exists.

He will hold going to the bathroom until I go down to where the many litter 
boxes are. Which does not help in regards to UTIs. My vet says he does that 
because while the litter box represents pain to him, having me there makes 
him feel safe. While I can ensure we are not dealing with a blockage 
situation (something I have dealt with 2 times), it has also set up a 
behavior issue.

For awhile it will seem like everything is on track. He goes when he needs 
to without me having to be there. Then if he perceives a change in some 
situation in the house, then we are back to square one.

Recently it was discovered he had gingivitis. While being treated for that, 
they found an infected tooth. Thought maybe that was the root to the 
problem with the urinary issue. As blood tests have shown nothing. 
But......he decided to poop on the bed. I immediately called the vet to put 
him back on antibiotics. The vet thinks this is a behavior issue so we are 
trying him on fluoxetine.

5 days into using it. He has times where he is really bitchy. Hissing and 
growling at the other cats and me, if I am trying to get him to use the 
litter box. Usually when he hisses I know its because he needs to go to the 
bathroom. But last night he was really angry.

So this morning I was able to get another pee sample (I am getting really 
good at doing this, lol) to see if he has another infection or if this 
increase anger is due to the fluoxetine.

Thankfully my vet is easy to talk to and does not put me off when I am 
discussing what is going on.

My point in this long story (sorry I got going and could not stop. Maybe 
someone out there has had the same issue and can shed some light) is that 
you have to keep searching for the root of the problem. Even if it means 
repeated conversations with the vet. In the end, I may have to keep him on 
a low dosage of antibiotics like we had to do with our Great Dane male who 
for some unknown reason kept getting UTIs. The low dosage made a world of 
difference.
comments.author: squirrel1ification

comments.text:
I'm sorry for your loss D: When Ilived with my parents, we had about 6 cats 
total, but there's only 1 left, whom I took with me when I moved out. They 
live right next to a motorway :/. Not a disease, but still hurts to lose my 
kitty cats >_<. The rest didnt really care that much :/.

But please dont let him get away with that :/.

Evil presented it right at your  doorstep, and you have the power to stop 
it, and make sure no one else gets discriminated... If you use this chance, 
you could save dozens of lifes!

Discrimination is against the hypocratical oath that all vets and other 
doctors swear to follow. If they dont, you can sue them and get their 
license pulled. (
http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/266652/Hippocratic-oath)
comments.author: Alissah Cat

comments.text:
You are so right Darcypink Cobb. I could have filed a complaint as Cindy 
Bird suggested but so much time went by between when he supposedly treated 
my little girl and when her problems game to light. Now I am super 
aggressive about getting answers and making sure what I am being told is 
being done is actually being done. If I don't agree with the treatment 
plan, I speak up.

I knew someone who took their very sick cat to an animal clinic that is 
open 24/7 one night. This place supposedly has a good reputation, can't 
prove it by me. But anyways when the cat was brought in the vet there, 
looked at the cat then said to its owner "Lady its only a cat." If someone 
said that to me, you can bet I would have been on the phone complaining not 
only to this idiots boss but also the state board overseeing vets. And I 
would also tell everyone I know about this vet.

Losing your pet is bad enough. But having to deal with people who have no 
business dealing with them in the first place is something I refuse to sit 
by and do nothing.
comments.author: squirrel1ification

comments.text:

human doctors can be so messed up and full of ego they won't accept that

comments.text:

comments.text:

We learn from our mistakes. And hopefully we do not repeat them. I have

top_comment.text:

top_comment.author: Molly Smith

comments.text:
This little guy has a genetic abnormality--he was a feral rescue and the 
whole colony has it which makes me sad for them having nobody to keep their 
eyes wiped.  They will have shorter life spans than him but if we could 
give him a long happy 22 years that would be amazing!
comments.author: Molly Smith

comments.text:
This is a common after-effect of cat 'flu. All it needs is a wipe with 
cotton wool moistened with boiled and cooled water. I had a cat with 
blocked tear ducts who lived to be 22 years.
comments.author: muskndusk

captions.text:
Hey, folks, this week
I'm putting it to you.

Everything that you think
I know that you don't know,
you can know.

And you can know
more than I know.
So you know, go get in the know.
Come on, folks.
Let's get catified, you know?
This is all about due diligence.

What I'd like to talk
to you today about is

empowering yourself,
but with knowledge.

I want to start this
episode by telling you
a story about my cat, Rabbi.
He died at seven years old.
And he died of diabetes.
It tore me up inside for years.

I didn't do my research into
the connection between nutrition

and diabetes, and
what cats need to eat.

Now if you know me now,
you know that that's
a big soapbox that I stand on.

If I would have
known that back then,

Rabbi might have lived
